hero_subtitle: Discover the beauty and mystery of Earth - our shared home
intro_title: Earth - The Blue Gem of the Universe
footer_quote: "We do not inherit the earth from our ancestors; we borrow it from our children"

hero_highlights.title: Resilient biomes
hero_highlights.description: From misty forests to coral cities, Earth balances climates, minerals, and living systems in harmony.

hero_highlights.title: Water in motion
hero_highlights.description: Rivers, rain, and clouds sustain every community, carrying nutrients from mountain peaks to the sea.

hero_highlights.title: Shared atmosphere
hero_highlights.description: Oceans and forests craft the air we breathe, reminding us that care for nature is care for one another.

initiatives_description: Communities everywhere are designing brighter futures with practical, nature-positive ideas.

initiatives.title: Cities turning solar
initiatives.description: Neighborhood microgrids light up homes with community-owned energy and new green jobs.

initiatives.title: Restoring wild spaces
initiatives.description: Indigenous-led stewardship revives wetlands, grasslands, and the species that call them home.

initiatives.title: Cleaning coastal currents
initiatives.description: Floating booms capture plastics before they drift offshore, keeping reefs and fisheries thriving.

actions_description: Choose one action this week to celebrate the planet where every story begins.

actions.title: Choose reusables first
actions.description: Carry bottles, utensils, and bags you love to cut single-use plastic from daily routines.

actions.title: Eat with the seasons
actions.description: Seasonal produce lowers transport emissions and keeps local growers thriving.

actions.title: Move mindfully
actions.description: Walk, cycle, carshare, or ride transit to explore your city with a lighter footprint.

actions.title: Champion local stories
actions.description: Share climate wins and challenges so neighbors feel informed, hopeful, and ready to act.

cta_title: Ready to build a greener future?
cta_description: Explore our guides, stories, and community projects to find your starting point today.
about_hero_subtitle: Discover the fascinating science and incredible beauty of our home planet
about_cta_description: Understanding Earth's incredible complexity helps us appreciate why we must protect it for future generations.

facts.title: Age
facts.description: Earth formed approximately 4.54 billion years ago through gravitational collapse of dust and gas from the solar nebula.

facts.title: Average Temperature
facts.description: The global average temperature that supports diverse life forms across different climate zones.

facts.title: Highest Point
facts.description: Mount Everest, the highest peak above sea level, continues to grow approximately 4mm per year.

facts.title: Deepest Point
facts.description: Challenger Deep in the Mariana Trench, the deepest known point in the ocean depths.

layers.name: Crust
layers.description: The outermost solid shell, including continents and ocean floors.

layers.name: Mantle
layers.description: The largest layer, composed of hot, dense rock that flows slowly.

layers.name: Outer Core
layers.description: Liquid iron and nickel that generates Earth's magnetic field.

layers.name: Inner Core
layers.description: Solid iron and nickel under extreme pressure and temperature.

timeline.description: Solar system formation and early Earth development from cosmic dust and debris.
Simple single-celled organisms emerge in Earth's primitive oceans.
Cyanobacteria begin producing oxygen, creating the atmosphere we know today.
Rapid diversification of life forms and emergence of complex organisms.
